intro: Viola chaerophylloides var. chaerophylloides, commonly known as the alpine violet, is a perennial flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central and Southern Europe. It belongs to the Violaceae family and is characterized by its compact growth habit and vibrant violet-blue flowers. The plant typically features heart-shaped, hairy leaves that are adapted to cold, alpine environments. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or grassy slopes at high elevations. Its flowers bloom in early spring, adding a splash of color to alpine meadows.
